column1: Despite having limited volunteers due to the #coronavirus pandemic the Society of St. Vincent de Paul is determined to make sure #Thanksgiving meals still get served. Thank you to heroes working hard to make this happen.  https://t.co/lZIMIPbqya

The Democrats weren’t willing to help schools and families with additional coronavirus funding—Senate Republicans tried that.   We want a smart relief package—but our country needs a coronavirus bill not a Turn-America-into-Venezuela bill. https://t.co/5T5lWFfVwG

As a lineman working through the hurricane season and a nurse on the #coronavirus front line this Terrytown family is sharing joy by ringing in the Christmas season a bit early.   That's Louisiana strength and service for you.   https://t.co/R2R1uYXiCN

Annalee Stevens is honoring health care workers fighting the #coronavirus pandemic with a very special American flag.   The 14-year-old Pineville High School student used her woodworking skills to celebrate the frontline heroes at Cabrini Hospital.  https://t.co/Kk4c9gB7Lk

Senate Republicans just voted to put American and Louisiana workers families and businesses first.   Democrats again killed the bill and snuffed out hope for the #coronavirus relief Louisiana families so desperately need. https://t.co/d64ttWd1gG

Last time the Senate voted to send #coronavirus relief to Louisiana families and businesses 52 Republicans supported the bill.   So where's the aid? Every single solitary Senate Democrat who voted blocked it.

There’s no reason to delay the #SCOTUS hearings. If @senjudiciary members don’t want to be there in person they can appear virtually.   We’ve got masks we’ve got social distance we’ve got a job to do and we can do it safely. https://t.co/Dj2WU4DYbg

I’ve worked to ensure FEMA’s disaster relief fund gets the increase needed to take care of people hurt by storms and the #coronavirus pandemic.   This $17 billion infusion means Louisianians can take heart that the resources they need are there for them.  https://t.co/REcdYbZmbp
Louisiana is still fighting the #coronavirus pandemic and this $7.5M will support key health projects and research in New Orleans Lafayette and Shreveport.  https://t.co/T1yuYmGdIJ

Small businesses represent 97% of employers in Louisiana—that’s nearly 1 million Louisiana jobs.  These businesses needed cash flow to survive the #coronavirus crisis.   Now they need those loans forgiven to rebuild from Hurricane #Laura.  https://t.co/V9MQUQUuRD

Louisianians have faced the #coronavirus and Hurricane Laura with courage.   Giving tax relief to people and businesses hit hard by natural disasters is a no-brainer. Glad to work with @SenBillCassidy on this.  https://t.co/A1THhtTKap

Love your dog cat or bird? My pups Charlie and Jack are part of our family.  I just introduced the PUPS Act to help keep pets and people safe and TOGETHER during public health emergencies like the #coronavirus.  https://t.co/guKiM7TwIZ

52 Senate Republicans just voted to give Americans aid for unemployment small business schools child care and fighting the #coronavirus.   Meanwhile Democrats are holding out for a $1 trillion bailout of NY and California governments. https://t.co/rtJpecEGbf

Today the Senate votes on targeted help for families kids and workers hurt by the #coronavirus.  I bet if Sen. Schumer would release them a number of Democrats would join Republicans in helping restart the economy that government shut down. https://t.co/v0DyYccKY3

Hurricane #Laura hit as a category 4 storm in the middle of a #coronavirus pandemic that already battered Louisiana.   Laura’s winds topped 170 mph. We’re asking the Senate for emergency supplemental aid because our people need it. https://t.co/mFNZOtiUsA

Good news for Louisiana: USDA has made crawfish farmers eligible for relief through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program and extended the deadline to 9/11.   Thankful USDA gave ear to the good work and urgent needs of Louisiana’s crawfish industry: https://t.co/uAPepRCfq7 https://t.co/hiu7LNvz4Z

Fraudsters are using the #coronavirus pandemic to target Louisiana’s senior citizens but Edith’s Bill would help victims recover.   Thankful to be fighting scam artists alongside @SenBillCassidy and @AGJeffLandry.

Louisiana is home to 57 rural hospitals. 44% are currently operating at a loss.  We should be ensuring the survival of America’s rural hospitals during the #coronavirus pandemic not speeding up their closure.  https://t.co/UyHusCJCQa

A Democratic congressman from our sister state of Massachusetts said that Louisianians and other Southerners are “getting what was coming to them” from COVID-19.   Why would anyone want someone else to contract the virus?    https://t.co/ydUU6j7Omx

How did Destrehan High School junior @kailie_carrigee celebrate her 16th birthday? By collecting donations for Second Harvest Food Bank to help feed families impacted by the #coronavirus in the New Orleans area.   Way to give back Kailie!   https://t.co/rNgPZE4ep1

The most pressing problem we have with the current coronavirus bill is unemployment insurance. We can't pay folks more to stay home than to work but people need help.   The Senate should put a simple unemployment bill up for a vote and I think we can then come to an agreement. https://t.co/vPEur1stj6
The U.S. Dept of Health is sending 97 more cases of remdesivir to Louisiana. We can’t stop fighting each day against the #coronavirus and for the health of everyone in our great state.

We must continue to care for and ensure the safety of children and their families during this pandemic. This $1M will help reimburse @LouisianaDCFS for its response to the #coronavirus.  https://t.co/xhMbn4YdkJ

.@realDonaldTrump has always made certain Louisiana gets the resources we need to fight #coronavirus.   We’re thankful for this supply of remdesivir and for the lives it will help.  https://t.co/OWWRV0yeMX
This $58M will support key health and education programs to help Louisianians build healthy futures during the #coronavirus.   https://t.co/9QQp6vd3MV

Louisiana’s health care professionals have worked hard to mitigate the #coronavirus pandemic and this $11 million in HHS funding will help hospitals keep preparing for public health emergencies.  https://t.co/eZCJq72rRc
This $4.8 million in funding from the Federal Transit Administration will help Monroe support key public transit services as it recovers from the #coronavirus outbreak.  https://t.co/Le8V3SELJo
The IRS just sent almost $1.4B in #coronavirus relief to dead people. If only someone had sounded the alarm and offered a solution in 2019 . . .   https://t.co/BVrvPTgito

FEMA and Louisiana took unprecedented steps to respond to the #coronavirus pandemic. This funding will help Louisiana Children’s Medical Center and Baton Rouge General Hospital pay for vital resources needed to save lives.  https://t.co/8YUmuOXVF2

The #coronavirus pandemic has heavily impacted Louisiana’s most vulnerable populations.   This $202M in funding will help support critical health and education programs serving our neighbors and kids.   https://t.co/d0GslunuIA

As Louisiana flattens the #coronavirus curve we should continue to support the wellbeing of our communities and neighbors.   This $18.3M will provide a diversity of resources to help our state recover.  https://t.co/Uqlqd9JTNC
Speaker Pelosi’s $3T bill is her attempt to remake Western Civilization. It’s not a #coronavirus bill. https://t.co/m8CCZJfYIh
Expanded #coronavirus testing is how we help Louisianians get back to work and school safely AND soon. Glad this $8.5M from @HHSgov will help our rural areas do just that.  https://t.co/JmXf4wygVX

Americans are working tirelessly and selflessly to help us overcome the #coronavirus pandemic. Honored to be at work literally beside people who show us the American spirit in action. https://t.co/HGmXiQySgO

Despite Speaker Pelosi’s $3 TRILLION gambit Congress can't appropriate enough money to buy the U.S. economy.  Only 1 thing is going to lift us out of the #coronavirus economy: the American people and private sector. We have to open up safely and soon. https://t.co/eQtfzl3COy
Great to see Louisiana getting $10.5 million from @HHSGov to expand #coronavirus testing in 36 health centers.  The better our testing the more lives and jobs we can protect.  https://t.co/wOsXs96UlE

Today the #NationalDayOfPrayer we ask God to heal our hurting nation and trust him to act.  I'm praying with you for people impacted by the #coronavirus and I'm thanking God for the heroes who protect the health of their fellow Americans. https://t.co/uN7U2WXl5b

The Navy’s @BlueAngels just gave a well-deserved salute to Louisiana’s health care heroes first responders and military.   These selfless workers help make #AmericaStrong as we fight #coronavirus! https://t.co/DakulkMqZs

I’m asking @TheJusticeDept not to release Allen Stanford early.  Criminals who preyed on vulnerable and elderly people shouldn’t get to capitalize on the #coronavirus pandemic.  https://t.co/xPRW57oZAn https://t.co/NUZdpkW0hp
Louisiana newspapers and broadcasters have been hit hard.    They’re keeping the public informed during the #coronavirus crisis and deserve #SmallBiz relief. https://t.co/sqBSsxtksQ

America has lost 22M jobs because of the #coronavirus pandemic but we can save a lot if we refuel the #PaycheckProtectionProgram fast.  It's the worst possible time for Democrats to try to take advantage of the American people by tethering their pay to unrelated issues. https://t.co/gJIfkRrEFY

Congress could pass clean #coronavirus relief bills . . . if Speaker Pelosi would agree to it.   Right now though Democrats are sacrificing jobs by holding the #PaycheckProtectionProgram hostage. https://t.co/lj5jqmHsvQ

China’s leadership has a very casual relationship with the truth.  China has some explaining to do about the origin of the #coronavirus and Congress and the entire world need to investigate this. https://t.co/dbPHgN4pUg

This $475M of @HHSGov funding will help Louisiana health care providers keep their doors wide open to our families and neighbors.   Now isn’t the time to cut care or cut corners and I’m glad to see the CARES Act in action against the #coronavirus.  https://t.co/7DHhhhnBl9

Communities across Louisiana are fighting the #coronavirus with everything they’ve got.   This $8.3M in funding from @HRSAgov will help protect the health of workers and families.   https://t.co/Qu1JahNKDD

Oil and gas jobs are at risk because 1. the #coronavirus hurt demand and 2. Russia and Saudi Arabia are fighting like kids in the backseat of a minivan.  It's time for that spat to stop so we can stabilize prices and save jobs. https://t.co/tXj3PePb4Q
Louisianians are coping with #coronavirus thanks to our #HeroesInScrubs—We have the best doctors nurses and health professionals in the world! https://t.co/rsaPpaOATc

Louisiana oil and gas workers need flexibility as we fight the #coronavirus.   @SenBillCassidy and I are asking @POTUS for critical royalty relief for the independent energy producers who have helped make America energy independent.  https://t.co/ylMxFgMYcn

Know a small business with questions about how @SBAgov can help them keep employees on payroll?   The Paycheck Protection Program provides 8 weeks of cash-flow help to employers who maintain their payroll during the #coronavirus: https://t.co/K5E2ZY5slz https://t.co/ntCQz6BZQy

Unless you were throwing the frisbee in the quad during Econ 101 you know deficits matter.   We've just dedicated a lot of #coronavirus money to helping our people. Let’s see that work before we give Pelosi more chances to spend good money on her bad ideas. https://t.co/Eb3OeQnIt0

I’ve spoken with @fema about getting more ventilators and #coronavirus resources to LA.   Louisianians have a lot of experience being resilient in the face of natural disasters and we’re thankful for prayers from @marthamaccallum and everyone remembering our state right now. https://t.co/XcPbkTrges

Louisiana residents have @SecretarySonny and his team to thank for filling up our food banks in areas hit hardest by the #coronavirus. We have to work on multiple fronts to make sure Louisiana families have food on their tables.   https://t.co/0bsjvca9jh
Democrats took advantage of the #coronavirus pandemic to fund their pet projects and thought the American people wouldn’t notice—but they did. https://t.co/TzKt6hKTiO

Louisiana property owners are struggling under the coronavirus pandemic and need flexibility to care for their families. Great to see @fema extend the grace period for flood insurance from 30 to 120 days.  https://t.co/8rd6dpxbmj

While we've worked to get #coronavirus relief out to safeguard lives abortion advocates want to put more lives at risk by keeping abortion providers up and running.   Why doesn't even a pandemic seem to dampen their quest to end innocent lives?  https://t.co/T3Kf8Jp81q

Incredible to see the way Louisianians come together. @LA_College professor Natalie Maxey is using a 3D printer to make face masks for health care workers fighting the #coronavirus and locals are pitching in!  https://t.co/LYh0nezG28

The CARES Act is the best path open to us for preserving and reviving our economy as Louisiana battles the #coronavirus.  While far from perfect this bill gives families workers and employers the resources they need to be RESILIENT.  https://t.co/ClaKXpjUlT

The Senate's #coronavirus relief bill provides money to supplement state and local governments as they fight this virus.  What does that mean for Louisiana? $1.8B in aid according to a Congressional Research Service estimate https://t.co/QmLHF9B5b4

Thank you @realDonaldTrump for sending vital resources to help Louisiana recover from #coronavirus by granting a major disaster declaration. This will protect lives and livelihoods in our great state. https://t.co/VOUWmc3MSG

It is no secret that Louisiana workers and families need practical help to get through this #coronavirus crisis.    I’m asking @realDonaldTrump to make critical resources available to our communities by issuing a major disaster declaration for Louisiana. https://t.co/1MyHk9M9K1

Unfortunately China was more interested in its image than the world's health so they sat on the truth about the #coronavirus.   I'm asking @realDonaldTrump to declare Louisiana a major disaster so that we can get major relief for workers and families. https://t.co/xRPZSGgvGJ

This $31M grant from @fema brings resources to slow the spread of the #coronavirus.  But Louisiana workers need more help from Congress yet Democrats still refuse to let us move forward.   Why? Democrats want wind & solar tax credits more than jobs.  https://t.co/n5Bt4ytEEJ

Reality is calling but Democrats keep hanging up.   In the middle of the #coronavirus health crisis Democrats demand Congress offsets carbon emissions or else they'll strangle Americans economically.   We have days—not months—to get help to businesses & workers. End the games. https://t.co/KZAxbdtWVi

We have to stop thinking about the next election and start thinking about the next generation.   What are we going to leave to our children if Democrats allow this economy to crash?   Let’s pass the CARES Act for immediate #coronavirus relief! https://t.co/JKExG0i7OK

This afternoon Louisiana was issued a stay-at-home order that lasts through April 12.   As we all work to combat the spread of the #coronavirus here's what this order means for you and your loved ones: https://t.co/Q0zNh25WJr

Louisianians like Americans are victors. We are not victims.  Right now the Senate is working out a way to get money to businesses and people who are laid off to keep them going until our economy can get back to normal.    We will get through the #coronavirus together. https://t.co/PiBfkmBMJY

#coronavirus update:  Americans now have until July 15 to file their taxes without risking penalties.   For many taxpayers and businesses expecting refunds filing sooner still means getting your money faster.  Louisiana has also extended the state sales tax deadline to May 20. https://t.co/3dRkqHTv3N

Encouraging news in our fight against the #coronavirus:   @HHSgov is launching 3 community-based testing sites in Louisiana today. The federal government is providing these drive-through sites with supplies in order to expand the availability of tests in our state.

Louisiana businesses and employees are struggling through no fault of their own and they need relief fast.   @SBAgov has now made low-interest disaster loans available to hardworking Louisianians in the wake of the #coronavirus.  Apply here: https://t.co/zMQi1kI6Zx

While @realDonaldTrump takes the bold step of filling up our strategic reserve as we fight the #coronavirus we also need to remember the offshore oil workers and independent operators who support America’s economy as well as our energy independence.

If we’re smart about this we can address the #coronavirus on both health and economic fronts.   I’m working with Senate colleagues right now to support families vaccine development and the small businesses that employee countless American workers. https://t.co/gW66i09T9C

On this National Day of Prayer we turn to a God who is strong wise & loving.   Becky & I are praying for everyone in Louisiana affected by the coronavirus—those who are suffering the families who have lost loved ones & the health care providers who are caring for the sick.
You know how Americans handle their fears?   We face them.   Thankful @realDonaldTrump is on this #coronavirus challenge like wet on water. https://t.co/P4B2MfhEll

This $7.8M in funding from the @CDCgov will help Louisiana respond to coronavirus.    I’ll continue to work with @realDonaldTrump to protect the health and safety of our communities.    https://t.co/amxXrJJ9EX

I want to say as emphatically as I can: We're going to be ok.  1. We have the best health care delivery system in the entire universe and are working hard on a coronavirus vaccine.  2. The fundamentals of our economy—the strongest economy in all of human history—are intact. https://t.co/oaqTmlTYiu
The #coronavirus is not a time for politics.  This is a time to look the American people in the eye and tell them the truth.   Thanks @realDonaldTrump https://t.co/JQMInjiJNQ
